description: The Republic of Ireland's health minister says it is due to a "volatile" international situation.
title: Coronavirus: Irish government to introduce random testing at airports
title_page: Coronavirus: Irish government to introduce random testing at airports - BBC News
maintext: Pubs which do not serve food are due to reopen on 10 August and Mr Donnelly said the government would make a decision based on advice from the National Public Health Emergency Team and that he did not want to prejudge what it advises.
